title: When will Red Velvet disband? - Quora

response.answer_text: Right? I mean, I’m sorry but if a group whose alleged greatness is shoved in your face incessantly by the Pop Music industry and obsessive fans alike, it’s only a matter of time before great, massive negative reactions begin. Next thing you know, they’re thrust off the cliffs of our collective memories, forced to plummet straight into the canyons of disbandment. Irene is nearly 45 years old, Seulgi is drinking lake water in Slovenia, Wendy is now mute from her fall accident - unable to speak or run, Joy is a full-time model and Yeri is rumoured to replace Ellen DeGeneres as the host of ‘The Ellen DeGeneres Show’ (since ‘Yeri-han Bang’ is such a success), so they obviously no longer have much in common, no time to record music together and the “Luviebond” isn’t real. SM is also known to often disband their groups… Don’t get me wrong, I think Red Velvet are a decent K-pop girl group (even though I rarely listen to them). They may be regarded as the “Nation’s Girl Group”, “Nation’s Pride”, “Living Legends in the K-pop hall of fame”, “Culturally important artists”, “K-pop’s most musically interesting girl group”, “The Standard-Bearers of K-pop girl group conceptual versatility” and more… but I barely believe they’ve done a whole lot to warrant these statuses despite this foot-long resume which I simply don’t think necessarily means longevity or they have what it takes to last that long in such a competitive and saturated industry. They also have a few decent hits here and there with steady output, but I wouldn’t call them “Legends”. ALSO: I don’t see how they’re any better than Twice or Blackpink? IN FACT, to people who actually don’t like or are otherwise indifferent to them (totally not us), the fanfare that surrounds their critically-acclaimed and culturally important discography seems like some ridiculous messianic cult if you ask me. That’s probably why they’ll disband in the next 24 hours KST since the contrarianism is so rife. That’s right friends, Red Velvet is going to disband in the next 24 hours - give or take - and I for one, like many, will be waiting to feel 𝚍̶𝚒̶𝚜̶𝚊̶𝚙̶𝚙̶𝚘̶𝚒̶𝚗̶𝚝̶𝚎̶𝚍̶ commiseration at the inevitable but long-overdue tragedy.

It's very unlikely that Red Velvet will disband. SM Entertainment doesn't disband their groups. Instead, they might put them on a hiatus. Many older SM groups haven't disbanded yet. But maybe when the members' contracts expire, they might leave the group and company. If they did, there's a slight chance they could reunite one day.

Theoretically, because of the usual “7-year contract agreement” between entertainment companies and artists, Red Velvet is not expected to disband until AT LEAST 2023. If they renew their contract near their disbandment date, (if they agree) the group will continue to perform. However, as of now, SM has no intention of disbanding Red Velvet.
